bio: Entered father's construction business and expanded into slum redevelopment in 1996. Now chairs family's real estate firm Housing Development & Infrastructure Limited; son Sarang is its managing director. Stock has soared since last year's low. Also holds stake in housing finance company Dewan Housing Finance, run by his nephew Kapil. The two families split last year, stepping down from each other's boards. Has a passion for flashy cars.

name: Billionaires
bio: Father started an industrial oil business in 1958. Wei and his three brothers entered business and turned it into Ting Hsin International Group; best known-for Tingyi, the Hong Kong listed firm and one of China's fastest-growing beverage companies and is also a leader in Chinese-flavored instant noodles. Tingyi's products are mostly sold under the Master Kong brand, easily recognizable by a chubby chef icon. Eldest brother Ing-Chou is chairman of Tingyi.

name: Billionaires
bio: The third-eldest of the four Taiwan Wei brothers that founded Ting Hsin International Group. Family's Hong Kong-listed Tingyi today ranks as one of China's fastest-growing beverage companies and is also a leader in Chinese-flavored instant noodles. Tingyi's products are mostly sold under the Master Kong brand, easily recognizable by a chubby chef icon. Yin-chun is chairman of Wei-Chuan Foods, a Taiwan beverage company acquired by the family in 1998.

name: Billionaires
bio: Youngest of the four Wei brothers from Taiwan that founded instant noodle and beverage maker Ting Hsin International. Family's Hong Kong-listed Tingyi today ranks as one of China's fastest-growing beverage companies and is also a leader in Chinese-flavored instant noodles. Tingyi's products are mostly sold under the Master Kong brand, easily recognizable by a chubby chef icon. Yin-heng is leading the family's expansion into retailing: partner of Family Mart of Japan in Shanghai and owns Dicos, a fast-food chain with 1000 stores in China.

name: Billionaires
bio: Father started an industrial oil business in 1958. Wei and his three brothers entered the business and turned it into Ting Hsin International Group, better known as Tingyi. Today the Hong Kong listed firm ranks as one of China's fastest-growing beverage companies and is also a leader in Chinese-flavored instant noodles. Tingyi's products are mostly sold under the Master Kong brand, easily recognizable by a chubby chef icon. Second eldest Ying-chiao is a board member of Tingyi. Also oversees the family's growing investments in real estate; firm last year became the largest non-government investor in Taipei 101, one of the world's tallest structures.

name: Billionaires
bio: Parents ran a Louisiana newspaper. Sam grew up playing football, cleaning presses, selling ads. Studied at Louisiana Tech; stints at IBM, Honeywell. Founded computer operator University Computing with $1,000 1963; generated $57 million in sales by 1968. Added investments in insurance, restaurants, oil. Acquired controlling interest in arts-and-crafts chain Michael's Stores 1982; sold to Bain Capital and Blackstone Group for $6 billion in 2006. Flipped Sterling Software to Computer Associates in 2000 for $4 billion.

name: Billionaires
bio: Graduate of the People's Police School of Sichuan and former customs officer became a coke trader in 2000, later moved into coal production. Listed his Hidili Industry in September 2007 in Hong Kong. Lent out his own shares in connection with a company convertible bond sale in January.

name: Billionaires
bio: Cofounder of financial information and media juggernaut Bloomberg LP.  Launched financial data and analysis firm Innovative Market Systems with Michael Bloomberg, others in 1982. Renamed Bloomberg LP; sold Merrill Lynch on prototype of terminal that allowed for financial data analysis and made information on government bonds readily available. Merrill became investor and first customer, buying a $30 million cut in the company; sold 20% stake back to Michael Bloomberg for $4.5 billion in 2008. Zegar earned master's degree in computer science at NYU. Built software for Bloomberg terminals that provide quick access to information on financial instruments, ratios.
